subject: How many tests per test method?
msgSnippet: I have the following constructor in mind: SubsidiaryPurchaseRecord(String ssn, String name, String address1, String address2, String address3, String address4,
messageBody:
I have the following constructor in mind:

SubsidiaryPurchaseRecord(String ssn, String name, String address1,
String address2, String address3,
String address4, String address5, String
city,
String state, String zipCode,
String purchaseAmount, String locationCode)

Parameters address2, address3, address4 and address5 may be null.
However, no other parameter may be null.

I envision at least two ways to test the constructor for handling null
parameters. The first would be to create a test method called
testConstructWithNullInput(). This method would contain the following
code for each parameter that could not be null:

public void testConstructWithNullInput()
SubsidiaryPurchaseRecord record = null;
try
{
record = new SubsidiaryPurchaseRecord(null, validName,
validAddress1,
validAddress2,
validAddress3,
validAddress4,
validAddress5,
validCity, validState,
validZipCode,
validPurchaseAmount,
validLocationCode;
fail("created SubsidiaryPurchaseRecord with null ssn");
}
catch(NullPointerException success)
{
assertTrue("caught NullPointerException for something other
than ssn",
success.getMessage().indexOf("ssn") > -1);
}
// repeat for name
// repeat for address1
...
}

The second way that I envision would be to place each try/catch block
above in its own method named appropriately, e.g.,
testConstructWithNullAddress1().

I do not yet prefer one approach over the other, nor have I sought
alternatives. What is your preference among the two approaches above,
or what is your preferred approach if it differs from the ones that I
have presented?

Thanks very much for your time,
Craig Demyanovich
